model

Class Vertex

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.Vertex
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Vertex>

    public class Vertex
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Vertex>
    Class representing a vertex in a graph. Is comparable to other instances of this class.

    A few methods implemented in this make strong usage of methods that are provided by the following classes for the purpose of comparison between objects of a same class : https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/java/util/Objects.html https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/java/lang/Object.html

    Author:
    Teiki Pepin

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int nbr
      Number used to mark vertices through the Manhattan algorithm
      private int x
      The x coordinate for the vertex.
      private int y
      The y coordinate for the vertex.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Vertex()
      Allocates a new Vertex with the position 0 for the x coordinate and 0 for the y coordinate.
      Vertex(int x, int y)
      Allocates a new Vertex with the x and y coordinates given.

    • Method Detail

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Gets a string representation of this vertex. Overrides the toString() method.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a string value of this vertex's coordinates in the following format : "(x,y)"

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Compares an object if it is a Vertex with this one. If they both have the same position on x and y coordinate, it returns true. If they don't have the same position on x and y coordinate, it returns false. If the object is not a Vertex it returns false too.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        boolean value which is true if the vertices are equal, false otherwise

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Method returning the hashed value for an object which is used for comparisons. Makes uses of the hashing method provided by Objects.
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the reference of an object.
        See Also:
        Objects
